The Battle for Your Screen Time: Identity vs. Utility. 
‚ÄãWe are seeing two massive plays in the crypto app space right now. One wants to verify who you are, the other wants to handle everything you do.
‚ÄãHere is the breakdown: @billions_ntwk vs. @baseapp üëá
‚Äã1. The Mission 
‚ÄãBillions: It‚Äôs all about Proof of Humanity. In a world flooding with AI agents, they use ZK-proofs to verify you are a real human without doxxing your data. It‚Äôs the "Passport for the AI Era."
‚ÄãBaseap  : The Super App play. It‚Äôs not just a wallet anymore; it‚Äôs social, it‚Äôs trading, it‚Äôs messaging. They want to be the WeChat of crypto your single gateway to onchain life.
‚Äã2. The User Experience , 
‚ÄãBillions: Focused & futuristic. You go here to farm "Power Points," verify your identity, and build a reputation score that travels with you. It feels like a specialized tool for the next meta.
 
‚ÄãBase App: Broad & seamless. You go here to chat, swap tokens, and scroll a social feed where posts are tradable assets. It feels like a bustling digital city square.
‚Äã3. The Alpha 
‚ÄãBillions: The play here is Identity Farming. You are early to the "Human vs. AI" economy. Earning points now could mean big reputation leverage later.
‚ÄãBase App: The play here is Ecosystem Access. It gives you the smoothest lane to the exploding Base L2 ecosystem (memecoins, DeFi, consumer apps) with near-zero fees.
‚ÄãThe Verdict? ü§î
‚ÄãUse Base App if you want to live onchain (trade, chat, scroll).
‚ÄãUse Billions if you want to survive the AI wave (verify, earn, protect).
‚ÄãMy take: You actually need both. Base is the playground, Billions is your ID card to get in the VIP section.
‚ÄãWhich one are you opening first in the morning? üëá
(A) Checking my Power Points on Billions 
(B) Checking my portfolio on Base App 
‚ÄãLet‚Äôs argue in the comments.

The internet is broken. Bots, fake accounts, scams, and endless KYC have made it hard to trust anything online. To prove we‚Äôre real, we‚Äôre asked to give up our faces, IDs, and personal data and that‚Äôs not how it should be.

That‚Äôs exactly the problem @billions_ntwk is solving.

Instead of asking who you are, Billions only asks are you real  using cryptographic Proof of Reality, not surveillance.
No KYC. No biometrics. No personal data trails. Just private, secure verification that proves you‚Äôre a real human.

But Billions isn‚Äôt just about verification. It‚Äôs about building a full human and AI network based on trust.

Phase 1: Build a privacy-first network of verified humans and AI.
Phase 2: Connect humans and AI agents with verified reputation.
Phase 3: Unlock the Trust Economy, where real activity creates real value.

With the $BILL token, the community is empowered to grow the network, earn from participation, and benefit as the ecosystem expands. The more the network is used, the more valuable it becomes for everyone involved.

This is not about speculation.
This is about fixing a core problem of the internet.

A future where you can prove you‚Äôre real, stay private, earn for contributing, and interact with AI safely and fairly.

That‚Äôs why I‚Äôm bullish on @billions_ntwk.
Human first. Privacy first. Trust by design.

Privacy-first verification is no longer an experiment.

It‚Äôs production-ready.
It‚Äôs live.
It‚Äôs global.

And If it‚Äôs not about @billions_ntwk, it‚Äôs not the conversation.

The Billions Store Guide: Premium & Affiliates...

1/ What is the Billions Store? 
It‚Äôs the central marketplace for the Billions ecosystem. Here, you can buy Premium badge vouchers, manage your existing codes, and unlock your Affiliate link to earn rewards from your network.

2/ How to Complete the Setup?
To fully unlock the features (specifically the Affiliate Program), you need to complete a few verification steps:

Step 1: Buy a Premium Voucher. You can choose between a 1-year ($40.00) or a 6-year ($200.00) duration.

Step 2: Verify Email. Click the blue "Verify email to buy" button to secure your account.

Step 3: Claim Credentials. You must claim your "Email credential" and "Uniqueness credential." This ensures one real user per account.

Step 4: Accept T&Cs. Click "Accept" on the Affiliate Terms & Conditions to unlock your personal referral link.

3/ The Benefits of Going Premium 
Status & Recognition: Premium badges likely offer higher visibility and priority within the Billions community.

Cost Efficiency: The 6-year plan offers a significant "bulk" discount compared to renewing annually.

Asset Management: The bottom section allows you to track voucher codes, purchase dates, and expiration dates in one place.

4/ The Affiliate Program (Earning USDT + Power) 
Once your link is unlocked, you earn commissions from your referrals across three levels:
Level 1: 5% USDT + 5% Power
Level 2: 3% USDT + 3% Power
Level 3: 2% USDT + 2% Power

"Power" usually refers to a platform specific metric that might boost your ranking or future earning potential.

Everyone talks about privacy in theory.
Sony Bank actually had to make it work in practice.
As a regulated financial institution, they face a classic dilemma:
you must verify users, but you cannot afford to leak or over-collect personal data. Traditional KYC solves compliance ‚Äî and breaks privacy.

That‚Äôs where Billions‚Äô zero-knowledge KYC comes in.
Instead of storing sensitive customer data or passing it between systems, Sony Bank uses cryptographic proofs. The bank can verify that a user meets KYC requirements without ever seeing or storing the underlying personal information.

What changed in the real world?

‚Ä¢ No personal data exposure
‚Ä¢ No centralized honeypots for attackers
‚Ä¢ No friction-heavy verification flows
‚Ä¢ Full regulatory compliance
‚Ä¢ Infrastructure that scales at an institutional level

This isn‚Äôt a demo or an experiment. It‚Äôs live, working, and used by a major bank.

The important part here isn‚Äôt ‚Äúblockchain‚Äù or ‚Äúzero-knowledge‚Äù as buzzwords.
It‚Äôs the shift in mindset: verification doesn‚Äôt have to mean surveillance.
Sony Bank proved that you can:
verify identities,
protect privacy,
meet regulations,
and still build systems users can actually trust.
This is what identity looks like when it‚Äôs designed for the real world ‚Äî not just the whitepaper.
